_header: Saint Paul was a lither man ere he I-converted were
Subjects: saints’ lives; Paul, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Paul in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Poul was aluþer mon ar he conuerted wereAlle cristenmen
                    of þelond hadde of him gret fere…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& uor loue of seynt poul was lif ichabbe isedBring ous to
                    þe Ioie of heuene after þat we beþ ded

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint poul was a leþer man ar he I comwerted werealle
                    cristinmen of þe londe hadde of hym gret fere…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& for þe loue of seint poul whas lif ich habbe I
                    sedebryng vs to þe ioye of heuene after þat we beþ
                    dede

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
…Aȝeyn þe prikke to wince swiþe strong is
                    þeLord quaþ Saul þo what wolton do bi me…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And for þe loue of seint Poul hos lyf ichaue isedBring
                    vs to þe Ioye of heuene aftur þat we ben ded. AMEN. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint powel was a luþer man are he i couerted wereAlle þe
                    cristine men of þe lond hadden of him gret fere…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Seint powel to cristinedom cam in þusse manereGod us
                    graunti for is loue In heuene to ben is fere
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 189-92.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Poule was a luþer man er he conuerted wereAlle þe
                    cristen of þe lond of him hadde fere…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…And for þe loue of Seint Poul Whas lif I haue ȝou
                    sedeBring vs to þe ioye of heuene Whan þat we beo ded
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayn paule was a wicked man & of yvil dedeAl cristen men of
                    þe lande of hym had mekil dredeffor he was sterne man & fell &
                    shame he did ynogheTo cristen men whore he þaim fande for many one he
                    sloghe…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Sayne paule þe gude prechoure þou stalworth goddeȝ
                    knyȝtÞou brynge vs in to heuene toure amange þe angelȝ
                    bryȝt

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seinte poul was aluþer man ar he iconuerted wereAlle cristene
                    men in þe lond had of him gret fere…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…And for þe loue of sein poul was lif ich habbe
                    isedBringe us to þe ioie of heuene after þat we beoþ
                    ded
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.264-74.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Poul was a luþer man ar he conuerted wereAlle þe
                    cristene men in þe lond hadde of him gret ffere…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þou smitest him ffor Ihesu crist þat we serueþ
                    alsoÞo was Nero almost wod ne nom ham atte laste…
CamMagPep2344.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss of folio(s).

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint poule was a luþer man ar he turmentyd werealle cristen
                    men of þat londe hadde of hym grete fere…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& for loue of seint poul wos lyue ic habbe y sedebringe
                    ous to þe Ioie of heuene after þat we beþ dede

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
SEin poule was a luþer man ar he conuerted wereAlle cristen
                    men of þe londe adde of him grete fere…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…And for þe loue of sein Paul was lyf y have y sedBringe
                    vs to the Ioye of heuene after þat we beþ ded
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De conuersione Sancti Pauli (f. 115, by scribe in margin beside
                    first line); Paulus, Paul (RT)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEin poul was aluþerman ar he y conuerteþ werealle cristenmen of þe lond hadde of him gret fere…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& for loue of sein poul whas lif ichaue iseþbring ous to þe ioie of heuen after þat we beþ deþ
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xlviii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 98v).

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint Poul was a luþer mon ar he tormented wereAlle cristene men of þe lond hadden of him gret fere…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …And vor loue of seint poul whos lif ich abbe isedBringe vs to þe ioie of heuene after þat we beþ ded

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEynt poul was A luþer man ar he conuertide wereAlle cristine men of þe londe hadde of him gret fere…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …for þe loue of seint poul was lif ichabbe ysedBringe vs to þe ioie of heuene after þat we buþ ded

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEint Poul was a liþer man er he conuerted wereAlle þe cristene of þe lond of him hadde gret fere…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …& for þe loue of Seint poul whas lyf ich haue isedBring ous to þe ioye of heuene whan þat we beoþ ded

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Poule was a monquellere er he conuerted wereAlle cristen men
                    of þe lond douted his encombrere…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Saynt Poule to cristendome come in þis manereAnd god vs
                    graunte þurȝ his bone to be in heuen his fere

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Poule was a liþer man er he conuerted wereAll Cristen
                    men of euery londe were of hym in fere…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…And þe loue of seint Paule whos lif I haue yseydeBryng
                    vs to þe Ioye of heuene aftere þat we be dede. Amen.
